title: Matt Agnew reveals Chelsie McLeod made duplicates of the tattoo from their first meeting
text:
He was impressed when she gave him a temporary tattoo of the love chemical oxytocin on The Bachelor.

Now Matt Agnew has revealed his love Chelsie McLeod actually had more than one copy made of the scientific stencil.

On Thursday, the 32-year-old took to Instagram to share a black and white photo of the heartwarming diagrams.

Sentimental: Oxytocin has played a special part in the development of Matt (right) and Chelsie's (left) romance

'She made copies!' Matt Agnew revealed Chelsie McLeod made copies of the tattoo she put on him at their first meeting on The Bachelor

The astrophysicist, clearly smitten with her sweet gesture, wrote in the caption: 'She made copies'.

Oxytocin has played a special part in the development of their romance on the show.

During their date in the semi-final, Matt surprised the blonde beauty by gifting her with a necklace engraved with the chemical formula for oxytocin.

Lasting impression: On their first meeting Chelsie gave Matt a temporary tattoo of the love chemical oxytocin

Special formula: During their date in the semi-final, Matt surprised the blonde beauty by gifting her with a necklace engraved with the chemical formula for oxytocin

Chelsie later wore the same necklace when Matt professed his love for her on The Bachelor finale in South Africa.

In an indication things are getting serious between the reality lovebirds, Matt took to Instagram to share a photo of his ladylove sitting with his mother at what looked like a restaurant.

Matt captioned the happy snap: 'Finally giving Chelsie the grilling she deserves. #dinnerwithmum'.

Getting serious! Matt took to Instagram to share a photo of his ladylove sitting with his mother at what looked like a restaurant. He wrote in the caption, 'finally giving Chelsie the grilling she deserves. #dinnerwithmum'

On October 1, Matt turned up the heat in a different way when he stopped by a restaurant in Dubai.

The 32-year-old reality star decided to challenge himself by ordering the aptly named 'Inferno Wings' at the Claw Crabshack & Grill restaurant.

It wasn't long before he regretted his decision, describing himself as 'a foolish fool'.
description: He was impressed when she gave him a temporary tattoo of the love chemical oxytocin  on The Bachelor.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
